CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: PSFDTBT showed a number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of 23 kg / mol , a weightaverage molecular weight ( M w ) of 78 kg / mol , and a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 3.4. Because of the threedimensional structure of spirobifluorene units , PSFDTBT is readily dissolved in common organic solvents such as chloroform , chlorobenzene , toluene , THF , 1,2-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) , 1,2,4-trichlorobenzene ( TCB ) , etc. at room temperature. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) showed that PSFDTBT is of good thermal stability with less than 5% weight loss up to 340 ° C. No clear glass transition was observed from 25 to 300 °C in its DSC curves of the second heating and cooling runs ( 20 °C / min ). Optical and Electrochemical Properties. UV - vis absorption spectra of PSFDTBT in THF solution and in film are shown in Figure 1. In THF solution , PSFDTBT exhibited a broad absorption in the range of ultraviolet to visible region with two peaks located at 395 and 527 nm , respectively. In film , the absorption of PSFDTBT became broader and slightly redshifted with two peaks located at 401 and 562 nm , respectively. In comparison with the absorption spectrum in solution , the absorption spectrum in film became broader and red - shifted for about 35 nm , indicating the aggregation or ordered packing of polymer chains in solid state. Ordered packing of polymer chains is beneficial for improving the charge mobility of resulting films. 14 The optical absorption onset of PSFDTBT film is at 629 nm , corresponding to an optical band gap of 1.97 eV. PC71BM was chosen as the acceptor because it has similar electronic properties as PC61BM , but a higher absorption coefficient in the visible region with a broad peak from 440 to 530 nm , which compensates the absorption valley of the polymer. 15 As shown in Figure 1 , the PSFDTBT / PC71BM blending film ( 1 : 3 by weight ) has a strong absorption over a broad wavelength range of 400^-700 nm. The electrochemical properties of PSFDTBT were investigated by cyclic voltammetry ( CV ). The HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT was determined to be -5.40 eV according to the equation E HOMO = -e(E ox + 4.71 ) ( eV ) , where E ox is the onset oxidation potential in volts vs Ag / Ag + . 16 Since the open circuit voltage V oc of BHJ PSCs is correlated to the difference between the LUMO energy level of the acceptor and HOMO energy level of the donor polymer , 5,17 therefore a higher V oc for PSFDTBT based polymer solar cells is anticipated due to the low - lying HOMO energy level.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the given paragraph. We will present them in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name".

Here are the entities in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| PC61BM |
| chloroform |
| chlorobenzene |
| toluene |
| THF |
| 1,2-dichlorobenzene (DCB) |
| 1,2,4-trichlorobenzene (TCB) |

Note that we have listed the entities exactly as they are mentioned in the paragraph, including the chemical names and the solvents.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| PC61BM |

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name":

* chloroform

* toluene
* THF
* 1,2-dichlorobenzene (DCB)
* 1,2,4-trichlorobenzene (TCB)

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: PSFDTBT showed a number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of 23 kg / mol , a weightaverage molecular weight ( M w ) of 78 kg / mol , and a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 3.4. Because of the threedimensional structure of spirobifluorene units , PSFDTBT is readily dissolved in common organic solvents such as chloroform , chlorobenzene , toluene , THF , 1,2-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) , 1,2,4-trichlorobenzene ( TCB ) , etc. at room temperature. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) showed that PSFDTBT is of good thermal stability with less than 5% weight loss up to 340 ° C. No clear glass transition was observed from 25 to 300 °C in its DSC curves of the second heating and cooling runs ( 20 °C / min ). Optical and Electrochemical Properties. UV - vis absorption spectra of PSFDTBT in THF solution and in film are shown in Figure 1. In THF solution , PSFDTBT exhibited a broad absorption in the range of ultraviolet to visible region with two peaks located at 395 and 527 nm , respectively. In film , the absorption of PSFDTBT became broader and slightly redshifted with two peaks located at 401 and 562 nm , respectively. In comparison with the absorption spectrum in solution , the absorption spectrum in film became broader and red - shifted for about 35 nm , indicating the aggregation or ordered packing of polymer chains in solid state. Ordered packing of polymer chains is beneficial for improving the charge mobility of resulting films. 14 The optical absorption onset of PSFDTBT film is at 629 nm , corresponding to an optical band gap of 1.97 eV. PC71BM was chosen as the acceptor because it has similar electronic properties as PC61BM , but a higher absorption coefficient in the visible region with a broad peak from 440 to 530 nm , which compensates the absorption valley of the polymer. 15 As shown in Figure 1 , the PSFDTBT / PC71BM blending film ( 1 : 3 by weight ) has a strong absorption over a broad wavelength range of 400^-700 nm. The electrochemical properties of PSFDTBT were investigated by cyclic voltammetry ( CV ). The HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT was determined to be -5.40 eV according to the equation E HOMO = -e(E ox + 4.71 ) ( eV ) , where E ox is the onset oxidation potential in volts vs Ag / Ag + . 16 Since the open circuit voltage V oc of BHJ PSCs is correlated to the difference between the LUMO energy level of the acceptor and HOMO energy level of the donor polymer , 5,17 therefore a higher V oc for PSFDTBT based polymer solar cells is anticipated due to the low - lying HOMO energy level.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names in the paragraph and present them in a Markdown table.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| M n |
| M w |
| PDI |
| thermal stability |
| weight loss |
| glass transition |
| UV-vis absorption |
| optical absorption onset |
| optical band gap |
| absorption coefficient |
| HOMO energy level |
| LUMO energy level |
| V oc |

Now, let's analyze the entities in the paragraph and identify the property names:

1. M n - average molecular weight
2. M w - weight-average molecular weight
3. PDI - polydispersity index
4. thermal stability - refers to the ability of the material to withstand high temperatures without degrading
5. weight loss - refers to the amount of material lost during a thermal treatment
6. glass transition - a temperature at which an amorphous material becomes soft and pliable
7. UV-vis absorption - refers to the ability of the material to absorb light in the ultraviolet and visible regions of the electromagnetic spectrum
8. optical absorption onset - the wavelength at which the material begins to absorb light
9. optical band gap - the energy difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) of the material
10. absorption coefficient - a measure of the material's ability to absorb light
11. HOMO energy level - the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) of the material
12. LUMO energy level - the energy level of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) of the material
13. V oc - open circuit voltage, which is the voltage developed across a solar cell when it is in the open circuit state.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Property name of material" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Property name of material":

| --- |

| Mw |
| PDI |
| thermal stability |
| weight loss |
| glass transition |
| UV-vis absorption |

No clear glass transition was observed from 25 to 300 °C in its DSC curves of the second heating and cooling runs ( 20 °C / min ). Optical and Electrochemical Properties. UV - vis absorption spectra of PSFDTBT in THF solution and in film are shown in Figure 1. Sure! Let's identify the values of material properties in the given paragraph. We will present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Here is the table:

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 23 kg/mol | Average molecular weight of PSFDTBT |
| 78 kg/mol | Weight-average molecular weight of PSFDTBT |
| 3.4 | Polydispersity index of PSFDTBT |
| 340 °C | Temperature at which less than 5% weight loss occurs in PSFDTBT |
| 25-300 °C | Range of temperatures over which no clear glass transition was observed in DSC curves of PSFDTBT |
| 629 nm | Optical absorption onset of PSFDTBT film |
| 1.97 eV | Optical band gap of PSFDTBT |

| 400-700 nm | Broad wavelength range of absorption of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blending film |
| -5.40 eV | HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT |
| -e(E ox + 4.71) | Equation to determine HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT |
